p: Once selected as the priority issue for the agency, a Climate Change Action Plan (CCAP) was developed to guide the actions taken and resources required to address health impacts from climate change within Simcoe Muskoka. The CCAP also identified the required governance support and dedicated resources to allow for long-term planning. The CCAP took a three-staged approach, including: Phase I—Analysis of Current Environment; Phase II—Health Promotion and Engagement; and Phase III—the Integration of Climate Change into Health Unit Programming. Phase I involved the completion of a local climate change and health vulnerability assessment [ 17].
